channel.title: 🔥 Open Data hot twitter posts | by onData

item.description:

item.title: #es @ 1509228508735852553
item.description:
Un #metro en la zona metropolitana en #SanSalvador - más que necesario.
Más transporte inteligente, más movilidad humana, más espacios verdes, ah, con datos abiertos. Una tarea titánica de #inversión para #ElSalvador
En reunión con @Renfe Gracias @EESAenEspana y @big_onion_tech https://t.co/OfEIFFI0zE

item.title: #en @ 1508979156213714946
item.description:
I am not quite this pessimistic, but, this essay deserves a slow read. Important points made about the dualities of interest in science.
I may be naive but I struggle to see the downsides of #opendata. Especially when regulatory issues are involved. https://t.co/lisXi5bMWr

item.title: #en @ 1508808295729016836
item.description: #GIS #SAR reminder: 🚀🛰#Satellites have limited lifetime. 📡They like to be used and heard. It's still time to use #Sentinel-1A. Sentinel-1B, R.I.P. #OpenData #SARisBeautiful #GoldenAgeOfSAR https://t.co/8IlYcSAW27

item.title: #en @ 1508805178677415946
item.description:
I can fix nutrition science in 3 easy steps.
1. Mandatory pre-registration & adherence, including stats.
2. Statistician co-author on every paper
3. Open data
1 & 2 are total no-brainers. Easy. 3 is harder, but doable.
Why aren't we doing these basic things?

item.title: #en @ 1508801673044578312

item.title: #en @ 1508720793278103555
item.description:
Great to give a (virtual) talk in India hosted by @VenkRamaswamy, my most eastern so far!
Two Qs came up: 1. Do choice history biases correlate across tasks? 2. Are they driven by the first few trials people see?
Anyone? If not, these are great #opendata student projects 🧠

item.title: #en @ 1508715718522679296
item.description: I'll be moving onto @opendatacoop. I'm really excited about helping organisations to publish and use open data, about working on beneficial ownership, and to be part of a worker owned cooperative.

item.title: #de @ 1508677741230661635
item.description:
Letztes Jahr wurden in Schweizer KVAs 4mio Tonnen Abfall verwertet. Das sind 464 kg pro Einwohner.
Daraus wurden 1700 GWh Strom und 4200 GWh Wärme produziert.
Aktuelle Karten und Daten: Karte https://t.co/UyNkmoQi3m Daten https://t.co/BAUpaKxbHX Info https://t.co/agTE58ONhQ https://t.co/QPQrWN1CkP

item.title: #es @ 1508673777181331457
item.description: #Alcobendas coordina el grupo de datos abiertos y en esta ocasión se sentaron las bases de las acciones a llevar a cabo este año: destacando la revisión de la guía de datos abiertos, crear ordenanza tipo de gobernanza del dato y una guía de visualización de datos. https://t.co/HxZwEipyUE
